Rill Runner.background_description: You sing the stories of rivers and lakes, your talents soothing friends and the elements alike. You've seen more than most, but somehow it never seems to be enough.

table1.question: What songs are you best known for?

options.description: The Tinker's Two-Step. A humorous fairy tale about a gift-giving traveler. Start with a Reed Whistle. Anyone in earshot must pass a WIL save to perform an act of violence.

items.name: Reed Whistle
items.description: Anyone in earshot must pass a WIL save to perform an act of violence.

options.description: The Sylph and Her Lover. A bawdy tale of lost love. Start with a Breeze Knot (3 charges). Creates a strong breeze. Recharge: Tie it to a mast during a storm.

items.name: Breeze Knot
items.description: Creates a strong breeze. Recharge: Tie it to a mast during a storm.

options.description: Harper's Devotion. A sad, short tale about a musician who falls in love with a star. Start with a Celestial Lute. Reveals the constellations above, no matter the weather.

items.name: Celestial Lute
items.description: Reveals the constellations above, no matter the weather.

options.description: The Reed Fisher. A celebrated song about a massive carp that always seems to get away. Begin with a spool of River Twine (5 uses). Each dip into the river guarantees a catch, though it might not be pleasant.

items.name: River Twine
items.description: Each dip into the river guarantees a catch, though it might not be pleasant.

options.description: Song of the Silver Stream. A wordless lullaby that mimics flowing water. Take a Stone Flute that can calm almost any river.
The Thrush and the Meadow. A moody tale told in alternating chorus. Start with a Feather Quill (1 use, petty). A map drawn with this quill reveals the most expedient course between any two points.

items.name: Feather Quill
items.description: A map drawn with this quill reveals the most expedient course between any two points.

table2.question: What pays your way across the land?

options.description: Performing at taverns always yields both room and board. Sometimes you even get tips! Start with an extra 10gp.
You are a protector for those afraid to travel alone. Start with a Rapier.
You buy low and sell high, always making just enough to get by. Take a single item worth 20gp (or less) from the gear table.
You deliver delicate packages throughout the lands. You have at least one contact in any major town.
Over troubled waters and dangerous winds, you always make sure a ship reaches its destination. For you, passage is always free.
You shepherd caravans and travelers across water-soaked lands. Start with a  map (petty) relevant to your next journey.
